intro: Rondeletia stenostachya, commonly known as the narrow-stalked rondeletia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and clusters of small, fragrant, white to pink flowers. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded forest understories.
